channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Homology and cohomology of crossed products by inverse monoid actions and Steinberg algebras
item.description: arXiv:2506.20321v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Given a unital action $\theta $ of an inverse monoid $S$ on an algebra $A$ over a filed $K$ we produce (co)homology spectral sequences which converge to the Hochschild (co)homology of the crossed product $A\rtimes_\theta S$ with values in a bimodule over $A\rtimes_\theta S$. The spectral sequences involve a new kind of (co)homology of the inverse monoid $S,$ which is based on $KS$-modules. The spectral sequences take especially nice form, when $(A\rtimes_\theta S)^e $ is flat as a left (homology case) or right (cohomology case) $A^e$-module, involving also the Hochschild (co)homology of $A.$ Same nice spectral sequences are also obtained if $K$ is a commutative ring, over which $A$ is projective, and $S$ is $E$-unitary. We apply our results to the Steinberg algebra $A_K(\mathscr{G})$ over a field $K$ of an ample groupoid $\mathscr{G},$ whose unit space $\mathscr{G} ^{(0)}$ is compact. In the homology case our spectral sequence collapses on the $p$-axis, resulting in an isomorphism between the Hochschild homology of $A_K(\mathscr{G})$ with values in an $A_K(\mathscr{G})$-bimodule $M$ and the homology of the inverse semigroup of the compact open bisections of $\mathscr{G}$ with values in the invariant submodule of $M.$
item.dc:creator: Mikhailo Dokuchaev, Mykola Khrypchenko, Juan Jacobo Sim\'on

item.title: On periodic families in the stable stems of height two
item.description: arXiv:2506.20507v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We discover 110 infinite periodic families in the 2-primary stable homotopy groups of spheres. These families appear in seventeen different congruence classes of degrees modulo 192, four of them consist of simple 4-torsion elements, and another two of simple 8-torsion. They all vanish in the homotopy groups of the spectrum TMF of topological modular forms, but we show that they are detected in the fixed-points of TMF with respect to an Atkin--Lehner involution.
item.dc:creator: Christian Carrick, Jack Morgan Davies

item.title: Positivity in $T$-Equivariant $K$-theory of partial flag varieties associated to Kac-Moody groups
item.description: arXiv:2304.03353v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove sign-alternation of the product structure constants in the basis dual to the basis consisting of the structure sheaves of Schubert varieties in the torus-equivariant Grothendieck group of coherent sheaves on the partial flag varieties $G/P$ associated to an arbitrary symmetrizable Kac-Moody group $G$, where $P$ is any parabolic subgroup of finite type. This extends the previous work of Kumar from $G/B$ to $G/P$. When $G$ is of finite type, i.e., it is a semisimple group, then it was proved by Anderson-Griffeth-Miller.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Compton, Shrawan Kumar
